line_1: And to his sport the wary fowler hies;
line_2: Now the thick stubble, now the clover tries,

line_1: And to his sport the wary fowler hies;
line_2: To find where, with his race, the partridge lies.

line_1: And to his sport the wary fowler hies;
line_2: Whom force compels or subtle arts surprize;

line_1: When from her vetchy nest the weetless vagrant hies.
line_2: Her lessons teach to swell the capon's size;

line_1: When from her vetchy nest the weetless vagrant hies.
line_2: Or how the way-ward mother to chastise,

line_1: With eager strides swift thro' the streets he hies,
line_2: And at the portal for admittance cries,

line_1: Then, to the Wood, in Haste he hies;
line_2: Around the Plain he rolls his Eyes,

line_1: The gurg'ling riv'let to the valley hies,
line_2: With rustling sound the dusky foliage flies,
Despair sits lowering in her eyes,
There onward, dress'd in homely guise,

line_1: To the spot the housewife hies;
Back from the Sylvan bower he hies,
line_2: To thank his dear deliverer flies;

line_1: His simple errand done, he homeward hies;
From the fire-side with many a shrug he hies,
line_2: Glad if the full-orb'd Moon salute his eyes,

line_1: Then turns his ready steed, and on his journey hies.
line_2: Up to his sire he rais'd in mournful wise;

line_1: Then turns his ready steed, and on his journey hies.
line_2: His troublous thoughts, and clear'd each sad surmise;
